message:
Hi Geeks,
Currently i am working on a new .net project that aims to allow my customer to specify his own business rules which will be applied on some of  his products without returning back to me. 
Any advice how to start architect something like that? :(

data.message:
thnx for reply
what you meant by google for business rules engine?
do you mean "hammurabi" as rule engine or you meant i should search google?

For large scale apps, you should have a business rules engine "BRE" that comes with a UI suitable for your client needs. The app business logic will be dependent on these configurable rules. Your customer uses the UI to change the rules ---> the app behavior changes to reflect their changes.

If it is small scale and just some configurable parameters, probably you can just create a simple UI for your client to configure some DB-persistent parameters. In the business logic, use these parameters to change the behavior.
That's a pretty broad and vague requirements, I would urge asking for more specific examples on what are the types of business rules that are open for customers to specify.

:)
my customer have some of payment methods on his eCommerce site but each payment method requires some rules to be applied.
like product that have price greater than 3000$ can't have payment method x
product that have weight greater than 30 KG  can't have free deliver fees
Also he can do combination of 2 or 3 rules to create new rule. and so on

That sounds way more simpler than the original request :) at least it is scoped to payment system, how open the rules are, and how often they may change, if these rules are fixed (except for some values like weights and stuff) that could be even simpler
If you want something ready, try https://rulesengine.codeplex.com/ (I didn't use it before)
Also you can use specification design pattern. http://martinfowler.com/apsupp/spec.pdf
